alert.note: Alert for Ellsworth; Reno; Rice (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 21 at 5:53AM CDT until April 23 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility as low as one quarter mile in dense fog. For the High Wind Watch, south winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph possible. * WHERE...Ellsworth, Rice and Reno Counties. * WHEN...For Dense Fog Advisory...until 9 am. For High Wind Watch...From Friday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...For Dense Fog...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. For High Wind Watch...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Secure loose outdoor items as they high winds can pick them up and send them airborne.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
